meanings.definition: Having battlements with indentations and raised portions.
meanings.sent1: The crenelated castle walls looked like a giant puzzle.
meanings.sent2: The ancient fortress had crenelated towers for defense.
meanings.sent3: The crenelated design on the cake made it look like a miniature castle.
meanings.sent4: Her crenelated hairdo was a unique and eye-catching style.
meanings.sent5: The crenelated pattern on the fabric added a touch of elegance to the dress.

meanings.definition: To furnish with crenels or battlements.
meanings.sent1: The architect crenelated the walls of the castle for a medieval look.
meanings.sent2: They crenelated the tower to make it more fortified.
meanings.sent3: He jokingly said he would crenelate his house to keep out imaginary invaders.
meanings.sent4: Her words crenelated his heart, leaving him feeling protected.
meanings.sent5: The artist crenelated the sculpture to give it a sense of strength and history.

meanings.definition: A crenel or embrasure in a battlement.
meanings.sent1: The archer aimed through the crenelated opening in the wall.
meanings.sent2: The soldiers peered through the crenel to watch for enemies.
meanings.sent3: The tiny bird built its nest in the crenel of the old castle.
meanings.sent4: The sunlight streamed through the crenel, casting a pattern on the floor.
meanings.sent5: The view from the crenel offered a strategic advantage in battle.
